main.name: Brodie Brock
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: Use this bio section as your way of describing yourself and saying what you do, what technologies you like to use or feel most comfortable with, describing your personality, or whatever else you feel like throwing in.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.description: I am a current student at Vol State, I plan on continuing my education by attending a four year institute to finish my bachelors degree.

Digital Craft is a coding bootcamp out of Atlanta, Georgia. There I completed a Full Stack Immersive Program. I created fullstack applications using Node.js, MySQL, React.js, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. Even though this was a very hands-on experience building projects, we also were taught general theories and concepts to complex programming.

work.title: Junior Software Developer
work.description: Experience with creating and modifying scripts using mySQL, SQL, and mongoDB. Creating UI/UX design and wireframes for new business applications. Using Confluence to document the integration process for our POS integrations. Using Postman to test API calls created with node from our POS integrations. Experience with testing and documenting new features/bugs. Using Jira, Monday, and Slack, to communicate with members of our team.

work.title: Project Coordinator
work.description: Prospecting my own leads to develop relationships with business owners across North America. I generated over $100,000 in revenue for the company. Working daily with my team to hit our daily office number.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
